item.title: Type less, do more...
item.description:
If you are dealing a lot with the terminal you probably use the cd command very often. cd here, cd there, cd .., etc. What if I told you that you can avoid typing the cd command completely? That can save you a lot of keystrokes which is good because it:

  • Makes you more productive
  • Helps you avoid RSI problems, such as the infamous CTS

The first tool that I want to show you is autojump. Once installed, autojump (abbreviated by the command j) maintains its own database to help you navigate to a directory without the need to remember:
